intro: Chrysophae cretica, commonly known as the Cretan chrysophae, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and other related species. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Chrysophae cretica is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny environments.
